On Sun, 21 Oct 2001, Shane Duan wrote:
> > ----------------------------------------------------------------------
> > Without X-Display server (headless setup):
> >
> > Caught error java.lang.InternalError: Can't connect to X11 window server using 'foo.bar.com:0.0' as the value of the DISPLAY variable.
>
> I haven't been working on X Windows for quite a few years but I vaguely remember a 'xhost' command to allow a remote host connection for display to solve
> this problem.  Is that right?

You can set the DISPLAY environment variable like you say. However, in this
case I am using a Windows client and not running an X-Display server. This
also happens when I run the unit tests from a cron job which has no display.
Some people suggested using a "virtual x display" and that would be cool,
except I cannot install such software on the unix machines I am working on.
